title: (x) "Graphic designer" child-like script - Fig Script {Patricia}
content:
Would someone please help us identify this font?

Lots of love, Ida, Ida & Johnny

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Bilde 5.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/typophile.com/files/Bilde%205.pdf) | 5.04 KB |

 [‹ (x) Colours of the Desert airline script - Murray Hill {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18667 "Go to previous forum topic") [Ausreisser Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18454 "Go to next forum topic")
author: idatj

comments.content:
Seems to be a shareware font called [Little Days](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/westwind/littledays_alt.htm) by West Wind Fonts.

(edit: Nah, it is not. Just similar and it looks a lot like [Memina](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/www.type-o-tones.com/p_fonts/p_memi.htm). Hmm, maybe this is a knock off!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/daisy.png)

I think it’s Fig Script. Sample is a bit small.

[http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/fig/script.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/fig/script.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/fig/script.html")

I think you’re right Patty, about Fig Script, but while you located that I came up with one of Nick Curtis’s freebies called [’Lost Wages’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg5.html)that has a smoother, but similar feel.

- Mike Yanega
There’s always that Bjork Vespertine font too... which is hard to find now.

On Little Days and [MeMima](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=TO.6104.0.0): It is another case of an amateur’s rendering of a typeface as they saw it in print. As such, it’s not exactly a digital knockoff, but not a responsible design either. Though we disagree on the ethics, [Luc Devroye](http://web.archive.org/web/20080106112305/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/westwind.html) basically proves its similarity to MeMima on his site.
